description: High-quality gold standard cards for all 14 games. These serve as examples for LLM generation and emergency fallbacks.

quality_criteria.structure: Most likely to [SPECIFIC ACTION] because [ABSURD BUT BELIEVABLE REASON]

cards.text: Most likely to get into a philosophical debate with a Roomba because they think it's judging their life choices
Most likely to become a professional cave dweller because they already live like one
Most likely to argue with a GPS and still get lost because 'I know a shortcut'
Most likely to start a cult accidentally because they gave unsolicited advice at Whole Foods
Most likely to fail a vibe check from a house plant because even the ficus looks disappointed
Most likely to get cancelled by their own shadow because it's tired of following them around
Most likely to lose an argument with a Magic 8-Ball because it told them 'outlook not so good'
Most likely to be banned from a farmer's market because they argued that tomatoes are overrated
Most likely to become a conspiracy theorist about their own cereal because the flakes look suspicious
Most likely to gaslight themselves into thinking they're the main character when they're clearly an NPC
Most likely to write a strongly worded Yelp review about the sun because it's 'too bright and aggressive'
Most likely to get into a Twitter fight with a bot and lose because they took it personally
Most likely to ghost their therapist because the therapist asked too many personal questions
Most likely to become emotionally dependent on their phone's autocorrect because it's the only one who gets them
Most likely to develop a parasocial relationship with their food delivery driver because they see them more than their friends
Most likely to accidentally join a pyramid scheme thinking it was a book club
Most likely to schedule a meeting just to cancel it because that's the only power they have
Most likely to become a life coach after watching three TED Talks and having one good day
Most likely to be defeated by IKEA furniture and blame Swedish minimalism for their failures
Most likely to fake their own death just to see who would come to their funeral

quality_criteria.structure: Would you rather [OPTION A] OR [OPTION B]?

cards.text: Would you rather have hiccups every time you lie OR sneeze every time someone says your name?
Would you rather fight one horse-sized duck OR explain cryptocurrency to your grandma every single day for a year?
Would you rather only be able to whisper OR only be able to shout for the rest of your life?
Would you rather have wet socks forever OR have to rewatch the worst movie you've ever seen once a week for eternity?
Would you rather sweat mayonnaise OR cry hot sauce?
Would you rather have all your thoughts narrated by Morgan Freeman OR have elevator music play whenever you walk into a room?
Would you rather burp confetti OR fart glitter?
Would you rather have fingers as long as your legs OR legs as short as your fingers?
Would you rather always have to tell the truth during job interviews OR always have to lie to your mom?
Would you rather have a rewind button for your life but only for the last 3 seconds OR a pause button but only for 10 seconds once a day?
Would you rather have your browser history made public OR your bank statement made public?
Would you rather have to dance every time you hear music OR have to sing everything you say?
Would you rather be able to talk to animals but they're all incredibly rude OR be able to read minds but only negative thoughts?
Would you rather have a permanent clown face OR permanent clown shoes that squeak?
Would you rather have your phone die at 90% OR never be able to charge it past 15%?
Would you rather always smell like garlic OR always taste soap?
Would you rather live in a world where everyone can hear your thoughts OR a world where you can't use technology?
Would you rather have an undo button for life but only 3 uses ever OR a fast-forward button but you can't control where it stops?
Would you rather have all your exes in a group chat together OR have your parents follow all your social media burner accounts?
Would you rather sneeze every time you orgasm OR orgasm every time you sneeze?
The best excuse for being late: _____
If I had to eat only one food forever, I'd choose _____ because _____
My Tinder bio should just say: _____
_____ is the worst superpower you could possibly have
The real reason I'm single: _____
Red flag in a relationship: they collect _____
If there was an Olympics for _____, I'd win gold
My toxic trait is _____
Things that sound illegal but aren't: _____
My autobiography would be called: _____
I'd rather die than _____
The hill I will die on: _____
Everyone has that one friend who _____
If aliens landed tomorrow, the first thing I'd show them: _____
The worst thing you can hear after 'We need to talk' is _____
My villain origin story started with _____
If my life was a movie genre, it would be _____
The worst time to realize _____ is during a first date
My demon would be impressed if I _____
I'm not saying I'm Batman, but have you ever seen me and _____ in the same room?

quality_criteria.structure: They're perfect: [ATTRACTIVE QUALITY], but [DEALBREAKER RED FLAG]
quality_criteria.balance: Green flag must be genuinely appealing, red flag must be absurd dealbreaker

cards.text: They're perfect: great cook, amazing smile, but they refer to their ex as 'the one that got away' daily
They're perfect: fit, funny, rich, but they don't believe in cleaning dishes 'because germs build immunity'
They're perfect: smart, attractive, kind, but they think the earth is flat and won't stop bringing it up
They're perfect: successful, charming, great in bed, but they collect toenail clippings in labeled jars
They're perfect: artistic, passionate, attentive, but they cry every single time they see a bird
They're perfect: hilarious, caring, loyal, but they exclusively communicate in movie quotes after 8pm
They're perfect: thoughtful, adventurous, genuine, but they insist on bringing their emotional support chicken everywhere
They're perfect: brilliant, gorgeous, supportive, but they've never seen a single movie and refuse to start
They're perfect: wealthy, ambitious, romantic, but they still use a Hotmail address and won't change it
They're perfect: talented, humble, affectionate, but they insist their cryptocurrency will make you rich 'any day now'
They're perfect: cultured, well-traveled, educated, but they chew with their mouth open and think it's 'authentic'
They're perfect: athletic, charismatic, successful, but they talk to their mom on speakerphone during dates
They're perfect: creative, spontaneous, fun, but they've already picked out baby names and you met yesterday
They're perfect: stable, mature, responsible, but they sleep in a racecar bed and call it 'nostalgic'
They're perfect: compassionate, intelligent, driven, but they don't 'believe' in deodorant as a lifestyle choice
They're perfect: witty, generous, respectful, but they collect Funko Pops and the collection has its own bedroom
They're perfect: kind, patient, understanding, but they've never once washed their coffee mug and it's 'seasoned like a cast iron'
They're perfect: motivated, organized, sweet, but they exclusively listen to Nickelback and defend it passionately
They're perfect: empathetic, sexy, interesting, but they post Instagram stories of every single meal with #blessed
They're perfect: confident, protective, loving, but they've been in a parasocial relationship with a Twitch streamer for 4 years

quality_criteria.structure: Personal question that everyone answers AS the target

cards.text: What would you do if you won the lottery tomorrow?
What's your signature dance move called?
Describe your morning routine in exactly 3 words
What would your WWE entrance song be?
What's the weirdest thing in your search history right now?
If you were a kitchen appliance, which one and why?
What's your most embarrassing Spotify playlist called?
What conspiracy theory do you secretly believe?
What's your toxic trait in group chats?
If your life had a theme song, what would it be?
What food would you fight someone over?
What's the pettiest thing you've ever done?
What would you name your autobiography?
What's your go-to karaoke song?
If you could haunt one person after you die, who and why?
What's your most unhinged 3am thought?
What emoji best represents your personality?
What hill are you willing to die on?
If you were a villain, what would your evil plan be?
What's your weirdest flex that you're secretly proud of?
Your crush texts: 'what are you up to this weekend?'
Your ex texts: 'I miss us'
Your boss texts at 11pm: 'quick question...'
Unknown number: 'hey remember me?'
Your mom: 'We need to talk when you get home'
Group chat: 'Who ate my leftovers?'
Your roommate: 'can we talk about the dishes?'
Tinder match: 'send pics'
Friend: 'I have drama to tell you'
Delivery driver: 'I'm outside but I don't see you'
Dad: 'Call me when you can'
Person you ghosted: 'you there?'
Sibling: 'Mom found your thing'
Coworker: 'did you finish the thing?'
Wrong number: 'the package has been delivered'
Friend's partner: 'can I ask you something about [friend]?'
Gym buddy: 'you coming today?'
Dentist office: 'You missed your appointment'
Person from high school: 'omg how have you been??'
Your therapist: 'Looking forward to our session tomorrow'
Which one doesn't belong?
Which one doesn't belong?
Which one doesn't belong?
Which one doesn't belong?
Which coping mechanism doesn't belong?
Which communication style doesn't belong?
Who would you least want to hear from?
What's the biggest threat to humanity?
Which one doesn't belong?
Which dating behavior doesn't belong?
Which profession doesn't belong?
Which app doesn't belong?
Which generation doesn't belong?
Which investment doesn't belong?
Which personality system doesn't belong?
What do you least want to see?
Who would you least want to see your browser history?
Pick two - which one doesn't belong?
Which one doesn't belong?
Best post-breakup move - which doesn't belong?

quality_criteria.structure: Who would win: [OPTION A] vs [OPTION B]?

cards.text: Who would win: A gorilla with a sword vs 50 angry geese?
Who would win: Your search history vs your bank statement in a public reveal?
Better superpower: Flying but only 2 feet off the ground vs Invisibility but only when nobody's looking?
Who would win in a fight: One horse-sized duck vs 100 duck-sized horses?
Better life choice: $1 million now vs $10 million in 10 years?
Who would win: A lawyer who believes in you vs a raccoon who's seen some shit?
Better flex: Being verified on Twitter vs Having perfect credit?
Who wins: Someone who says 'I don't watch TV' vs Someone who says 'I don't have social media'?
Better villain origin story: Bad WiFi vs Wet socks?
Who would win: Your FBI agent vs Your NSA agent in a debate about your life choices?
Better superpower: Reading minds but only negative thoughts vs Seeing the future but only bad news?
Who wins: The friend who's always late vs The friend who's always early?
Better life hack: Never need sleep vs Never need to eat?
Who would win: Your inner demons vs Your responsibilities?
Better plot armor: Main character energy vs Side character who knows too much?
Who wins a staring contest: An influencer vs A therapist?
Better curse: Hiccup every time you lie vs Fart every time someone says your name?
Who would win: Ancient curse vs Modern student loans?
Better sacrifice: Delete all your photos vs Delete all your contacts?
Who wins: The you from 5 years ago vs The you from 5 years in the future?

cards.text: What will the room choose?

quality_criteria.believability: Believable yet sus - could be true or lie

cards.text: I once convinced my family I was allergic to chores
I've never actually finished a book I said I read
I accidentally joined a cult for 3 days before realizing
I've faked being sick to avoid a friend's wedding
I once catfished someone as my own best friend
I've never actually watched The Office
I once ghosted someone and then matched with them again 2 years later
I've never tried coffee and I'm 25
I once pretended to speak French for an entire date
I've lied on every job application I've ever filled out
I once stole a traffic cone and it's been in my apartment for 3 years
I've never actually washed my pillowcase
I once faked a British accent for 6 months at a new job
I've eaten food off the floor and served it to guests
I once convinced a date I was a professional backup dancer
I've never tried a vegetable that wasn't fried
I once created a fake Instagram to stalk my ex for 2 years
I've convinced multiple people I have a twin when I'm an only child
I once pretended to be vegan for 3 months to impress someone
I've never once actually read the terms and conditions
